longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival.

Visa required, except for Holders of an Overseas Citizen of
India Card or Booklet.
Visa required, except for Holders of a Person of Indian Origin
(PIO) Card. 
Visa Issuance:
- Holders of normal passports issued to nationals of Barbados
  arriving at Bengaluru (BLR), Chennai (MAA), Delhi (DEL), Goa
  (GOI), Hyderabad (HYD), Kochi (COK), Kolkata (CCU), Mumbai
  (BOM) or Thiruvananthapuram (TRV) can apply for a 30 day,
  single entry e-Tourist Visa at
  https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/. A printed copy of the
  e-Tourist Visa and a passport, valid for at least 6 months
  on arrival, containing at least two unused visa pages must
  be presented upon arrival.  
Additional Information:
- Indian law does not permit dual nationality for nationals of
  India.  
- U visas are no longer issued to those who have been granted
  Overseas Citizenship of India (OCI) status.
  
- Indian visa stickers have no seal/signature from the issuing
  authority. (SEE NOTE 57490)
    NOTE 57490: Not applicable to PIO card holders. 
- Nationals of Barbados being of Pakistani origin holding
  multiple entry Tourist Visas (type T), with a validity
  ranging from above 3 months and up to 10 years, are required
  to have at least 60 days between visits. (SEE NOTE 54918) 
    NOTE 54918: Those wishing to re-enter before the 60 days
   have expired must contact an Indian mission abroad to
   obtain permission.  
- Visa extensions possible, except for "T" (tourist) visas and
  Transit visas, by applying at the Ministry of Foreign
  Affairs. (SEE NOTE 57490)
    NOTE 57490: Not applicable to PIO card holders. 
- Valid visas in expired passports are still acceptable,
  provided accompanied by a valid passport of the same
  nationality of the expired passport.
- Holders of visas that specifically state the city/airport of
  entry must enter India at the specified city/airport. (SEE
  NOTE 57490) 
    NOTE 57490: Not applicable to PIO card holders. 
- Nationals of Barbados, belonging to a Tourist Group
   (SEE NOTE 57490)
    NOTE 57490: Not applicable to PIO card holders. 
- Restricted/Protected Area Permits: A permit is required for
  foreigners wishing to visit the following:
  
Warning:
- Passengers who have visited Guinea, Liberia, Mali or Sierra
  Leone within the last 30 days must enter India at Bangalore
  (BLR), Chennai (MAA) ,Cochin (COK), Delhi (DEL), Hyderabad
  (HYD), Kolkata (CCU) or Mumbai (BOM) and are subject to
  screening and medical checks upon arrival. 
- Visitors holding tourist or business visas must hold
  return/onward tickets. (SEE NOTE 57490) (SEE NOTE 57548) 
    NOTE 57490: Not applicable to PIO card holders. 
    NOTE 57548: Not applicable to holders of multiple entry
   visa, issued for validity period of at least 1 year.  Not
   applicable to holders of any other type of visa. E.g.
   Conference Visa, Journalist visa, Medical Visa,
   Missionaries Visa, Research Visa
vaccination:
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission For details, click here
and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to quarantine for 6 days. Quarantine facilities are
only available at Delhi (DEL), Chennai (MAA) and Mumbai (BOM).
At other airports passengers will be deported.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 6 months of age. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk (P. vivax and P.
  falciparum) exists in the whole country below 2000m. There
  is no transmission in parts of the states of Himachal
  Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir and Sikkim. Recommended
  prevention in risk areas: C.
